abstractText: A modern manuscript of the Upoṣadhāvadāna, "an account of an optional fast called Uposhadha or Poshadha [...] It is said to have been imparted by S'ákya himself. The work is divided into three chapters. The 1st treats of the history of the fast; the 2nd, its details; and the 3rd, its obligations" (Mitra 1882: 265). This manuscript contains apparently only the first two parts (Upoṣadhāvadāna and Doṣanirṇayāvadāna), and the language is very faulty.
